name: DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WELFARE, Respondent v. PRESBYTERIAN MEDICAL CENTER OF OAKMONT and Presbyterian Medical Center of Oakmont, Pennsylvania, Inc., Petitioners
name_abbreviation: Department of Public Welfare v. Presbyterian Medical Center

parties: DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WELFARE, Respondent v. PRESBYTERIAN MEDICAL CENTER OF OAKMONT and Presbyterian Medical Center of Oakmont, Pennsylvania, Inc., Petitioners.

opinions.text:
AMENDED ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 22nd day of December, 2003, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED, LIMITED to the question:
Whether the claims below sounded in contract and were within the subject matter jurisdiction of the Board of Claims, including its jurisdiction over implied or quasi-contract matters, for all periods at issue?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
842 A.2d 915
DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WELFARE, Respondent v. PRESBYTERIAN MEDICAL CENTER OF OAKMONT and Presbyterian Medical Center of Oakmont, Pennsylvania, Inc., Petitioners.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 22, 2003.
